intro: Haplachne, commonly known as the common goldenweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear leaves, which are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant is native to various regions in North America and thrives in dry, open habitats. Haplachne has a taproot system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of ecological systems in its native range.
